name: Fiskfélagið - The Fish Company
description: Fiskfélagið (The Fish Company) has established itself as one of the centerpieces of excellent cuisine in Reykjavík and a staple of the city's restaurant scene, offering creative seafood-focused dining that draws inspiration from culinary traditions around the world while maintaining strong connections to Iceland's maritime heritage and the exceptional quality of Icelandic fish and shellfish caught in some of the planet's richest fishing grounds. Located in downtown Reykjavík center just by Ingólfstorg square and a short walk from the harbor, the restaurant occupies a convenient location that provides easy access for visitors exploring the city's compact downtown while maintaining proximity to the fishing boats and fish markets that supply the day's freshest catch. The menu's innovative concept assigns each starter, main course, and dessert a country name—Iceland, France, Italy, Greece, Ireland, Japan, Argentina, Bora Bora—indicating the culinary tradition inspiring that dish's flavor profile, preparation technique, or ingredient combination, creating a dining experience that feels like a global culinary journey while remaining anchored by Icelandic seafood's exceptional quality. This approach allows the kitchen to showcase Icelandic ingredients (particularly fish and shellfish) through diverse culinary lenses, demonstrating that Iceland's ocean bounty works beautifully with Mediterranean olive oil and citrus, Japanese wasabi and soy, French butter and wine, or South American chimichurri and spices.

opening_hours.menu_concept: Each dish named after country (Iceland, France, Italy, Greece, Ireland, Japan, Argentina, Bora Bora)
